intro: Limonium gmelini, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its blue or purple flowers and silvery foliage. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in saline environments. Limonium gmelini is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance. Its flowers bloom in summer, adding a striking visual element to coastal landscapes.
